div.p: The plugin allows users to interact with the Oracle WebLogic server, such as starting and deploy application, starting Managed Servers and running Jython scripts.
To manage your WebLogic configuration, go to Administration > Plugins and click the EC-WebLogic Configure link.

Configurations have the following properties:
Configuration name - The name of the configuration.
URL - The URL for the WebLogic server, it must include protocol and port (example: t3://localhost:7001).
Credential - Username and password for the WebLogic server.

To use the plugin, you must first create a step. There are two ways to create steps:
Wizard step: When creating a procedure, do the following:
Click Add Step on the Steps panel.
Select the Subprocedure category.
In the Project field, select EC-WebLogic.
In the Procedure field, select the procedure you wish to execute.
Click OK.
Subprocedure step: To add a step to a procedure, do the following:
Go to the Procedure Details page for the procedure where you want to add the step.
Click the arrow adjacent to Create Step.
Select Subprocedure Step.
In the Project field, click Browse and select EC-WebLogic.
In the Procedure field, click Browse and select the procedure you wish to execute.
Click OK.
The subprocedure you select determines which fields are available.

The StartManagedServer subprocedure starts a specified managed server instance on the selected resource machine. Required credentials must be stored securely in a boot.properties file. The following fields are available for StartManagedServer:

ul.li: configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
instancename - Name of the instance to start.
scriptlocation - Absolute path of the start server script. It must include filename and extension.

div.p: The StartAdminServer subprocedure starts a specified admin server instance on the selected resource machine. The following fields are available for StartAdminServer:

ul.li: scriptlocation - Absolute path of the start server script. It must include filename and extension.

div.p:
The StopManagedServer subprocedure stops a specified managed server on the selected resource. The following fields are available for StopManagedServer:
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
instancename - Name of the instance to stop.
scriptlocation - Absolute path of stop server script. It must include filename and extension.

The StopAdminServer subprocedure stops a specified Admin Server instance on the selected resource. The following fields are available for StopAdminServer:
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
scriptlocation - Absolute path of stop server script. It must include filename and extension.

The CheckServerStatus subprocedure checks the status of the specified URL, by getting the returned HTTP code from the server. Curl is required.
The following fields are available for CheckServerStatus:

ul.li: additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by curl.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page). In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration.
url - URL to check.
usecredentials - Indicates if credentials must be appended to the URL.

div.p: The RunWLST subprocedure is able to run Jython scripts on the server. The following fields are available for RunWLST:

ul.li: wlstpath - Absolute path of wlst.cmd. It must include the filename and extension.
scriptfilepath - Absolute path the Jython script to be executed by WLST.
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by WLST.

scriptfilesource - Indicates the source of the script file.
Supplied file - Uses the file whose path is indicated in the scriptfilepath parameter and executes it.
New Script File - Indicates that a script file with the content of the scriptfile parameter will be executed.
scriptfile - Content of the script file to be executed in case that New Script File is selected in the scriptfilesource parameter.

div.p: The StartApp subprocedure is able to start an application on the server. The following fields are available for StartApp:

ul.li: javaparams - Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Java absolute location to use. Filename is required. Default value is java.
appname - Name of the application to start.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension.

div.p: The StopApp subprocedure is able to stop an application on the server. The following fields are available for StopApp:

ul.li: javaparams - Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Java absolute location to use. Filename is required. Default value is java.
appname - Name of the application to stop.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension.
gracefulmode - Enable stopping the application in Graceful mode.

div.p: The DeployApp subprocedure is able to deploy an application on the server. The following fields are available for DeployApp:

ul.li: javaparams - Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Java absolute location to use. Filename is required. Default value is java.
appname - Name of the application to deploy.
apppath - Absolute path, including filename and extension, of the archive to deploy.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by weblogic.Deployer.
targets - Targets on which to deploy the application or module.
envscriptpath - Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension.

div.p: The UndeployApp subprocedure is able to undeploy an application on the server. The following fields are available for UndeployApp:

ul.li: javaparams - Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Java absolute location to use. Filename is required. Default value is java.
appname - Name of the application to deploy.
apppath - Absolute path, including filename and extension, of the archive to deploy.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension.
gracefulmode - Enable undeploying in Graceful mode.

div.p: The RunDeployer subprocedure is able to Run weblogic.Deployer in a free-mode, specifying command and parameters. The following fields are available for RunDeployer:

ul.li: commandtouse - Command to be passed to weblogic.Deployer (Cancel, Deploy, Distribute, Listapps, List, Listtask, Redeploy, Start, Stop, Undeploy, Update).
javaparams - Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Java absolute location to use. Filename is required. Default value is java.
appname - Name of the application to manage.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension.
